title: `TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not subscriptable` & `failed call to cuInit: CUDA_ERROR_NO_DEVICE: no CUDA-capable device is detected`

labels.name: howtousedlc
labels.description: issue regarding the use of DeepLabCut

body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Bug description

We weren't using DLC for a while because our system went off. When we wanted to use it again, it gives us an error and didn't and stopped in the start training position.
The error:
Exception in thread Thread-1:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/rh/rh-python38/root/usr/lib64/python3.8/threading.py", line 932, in _bootstrap_inner
    self.run()
  File "/opt/rh/rh-python38/root/usr/lib64/python3.8/threading.py", line 870, in run
    self._target(*self._args, **self._kwargs)
  File "/home/engbrain1/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/deeplabcut/pose_estimation_tensorflow/core/train.py", line 80, in load_and_enqueue
    batch_np = dataset.next_batch()
  File "/home/engbrain1/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/deeplabcut/pose_estimation_tensorflow/datasets/pose_imgaug.py", line 363, in next_batch
    ) = self.get_batch()
  File "/home/engbrain1/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/deeplabcut/pose_estimation_tensorflow/datasets/pose_imgaug.py", line 298, in get_batch
    image = imread(os.path.join(self.cfg["project_path"], im_file), mode="RGB")
  File "/home/engbrain1/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/deeplabcut/utils/auxfun_videos.py", line 349, in imread
    return cv2.imread(path)[..., ::-1]  # ~10% faster than using cv2.cvtColor
TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not subscriptable


### Operating System

operating system= CentOS Linux V. 7 (Core)

### DeepLabCut version

dlc version =2.2

### DeepLabCut mode

single animal

### Device type

gpu = RTX 2080 Ti

### Steps To Reproduce

_No response_

### Relevant log output

